Cuban guests visit Sinchon Museum
   Pyongyang, June 9 (KCNA) -- Cuban ambassador to Korea Jose Manuel Inclan Embade and his embassy officials Tuesday visited the Sinchon Museum  in South Hwanghae Province on the occasion of the June 25-july 27 month of international solidarity with the Korean people.   The museum exposes monstrous crimes committed by U.S.  aggressors by massacring in a most brutal manner 35,383 inhabitants, or one fourth of the county's population, in 52 days, when they occupied the county during the Fatherland Liberation War (June 1950-july 1953).   
The massacre perpetrated by them in Sinchon put into the shade the barbarism committed by Nazi Germany in Oswiecim during World War II. 
   The Cuban guests looked round exhibits and visual aids, an air raid shelter of the former Sinchon county party and the Wonam-ri powder magazine where U.S. aggressors burnt to death more than 900 patriots, a tomb of 5,605 patriots, a tomb of 400 mothers and a tomb of 102 children.
   The visitors laid bunches of flowers at the tombs and observed a moment's silence.

articles.content:
Vietnamese embassy officials help farmers
    Pyongyang, June 9 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese ambassador to Korea le Xuan Vinh and his embassy officials visited the Korea-Vietnam Friendship Jamjin Co-op Farm  on Tuesday to help it in farming.   The guests, who called at the co-op farm in Kangso district, Nampho, on the significant day which marks the 30th anniversary of the on-site guidance of the President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il to the farm, helped farmers in transplanting rice seedlings.   During a break, they sang songs together with farmers and conversed with them, deepening friendly feelings.
